content:
Yes, there are many notable Victoria Cross recipients throughout the history of the award. Some examples include:

1. Captain Sir Tom Moore, who received the Victoria Cross for his heroic actions during World War II. He was awarded the medal for his service as a member of the Royal Army Medical Corps, and in particular for his role as a stretcher-bearer during the Burma campaign.

2. Lance Corporal Johnson Beharry, who was awarded the Victoria Cross for his heroism while serving in Iraq in 2004. He suffered serious injuries while driving a vehicle under heavy enemy fire but managed to save the lives of his comrades.

3. Sergeant Major Daniel Joseph Laidlaw, who was awarded the Victoria Cross for his actions during the Falklands War in 1982. He led his platoon in an attack on enemy positions, despite suffering serious injuries, and managed to capture a key hilltop position.

4. Captain Noel Chavasse, who was awarded the Victoria Cross twice for his actions during World War I. He was a medical officer and displayed exceptional courage under fire, saving the lives of many wounded soldiers.

5. Lance Sergeant John Baskeyfield, who was awarded the Victoria Cross posthumously for his actions during the Battle of Arnhem in World War II. Despite being severely wounded, he remained at his post and continued to fight until he was killed.

These are just a few examples of the many brave soldiers who have been awarded the Victoria Cross over the years.
